On the weapons of mass destruction that never surfaced despite being cited by the President Bush administration as the primary justification for the war, Donald Rumsfeld acknowledged: My goodness, the intelligence was certainly wrong. But he categorically refused to to say whether he would have acted differently had he known then what he knows now about Saddam Hussein 's alleged weapons.

The CEO shift won't result in major strategic changes, the executives said.`` We really agree on strategy,'' Page said. This is really a way of changing the way we're making decisions and the way we're operating. But I definitely don't think there will be any major changes in strategy. its current workers are located. In a speech Tuesday, Eric Schmidt said Google Inc. will hire more than 1,000 workers in Europe this year. All told, Google Inc. has more than 60 offices in 30 countries. At this stage, the number of opportunities just vastly exceed the number of people we have at the company, said Alan Eustace , Google Inc. 's senior vice president of engineering and research. Even if it surpasses 31,000 employees this year, Google Inc. will still have far fewer people than Microsoft Corp., probably its fiercest rival.
